intro: Elatostema orientale var. longeacuminatum, commonly known as the long-acuminated elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers with prominent stamens. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in plant morphology and ecology.
